title: Rook's Rest
description: A square, compact stone prison at the island’s core, guarded within and without. Only one gate in—and none out, for most.

title: The Spire
description: A looming, austere tower visible across the city — home to the city’s dominant faith.

title: Caskside Docks
description: Westernmost docks, services much of the small nearby craftsmen.

title: Cove Docks
description: Docks found near the underside of the causeway. Large haulropes move cargo between the docks and the upper city.

title: Drummond's Mill
description: A large and sprawling lumbermill found at the Southern edge of the Island. Drummond's has ruthlessly consumed all of the nearby independent mills in a bid to control the industry.

title: Salt Vaults
description: Cool underground chambers storing dried goods, salted fish, and grain.

title: Sootsmiths
description: The various businesses located on the South side of the island that concern themselves with the generation and sale of charcoal to city residents.

title: Giant's Causeway
description: A raised ruined causeway used as a military parade and training ground.

title: The Oath House
description: Official contract hall where mercenary companies register and are paid. Found near Garrison Row.

title: The Blackspans
description: Twin stone bridges, ancient and scarred, linking the island to both city banks. Caravans and patrols cross at all hours.

title: The Blackspans
description: Twin stone bridges, ancient and scarred, linking the island to both city banks. Caravans and patrols cross at all hours.

title: Market Gate
description: Main entrance to the lower city. Commonly congested with temporary stalls from rural vendors.

title: Twin Gates
description: Main entrance to the upper city. Gilded twin gates.

title: The Spine
description: Ramped causeway that connects the Lower and Upper cities.

title: Southern Logflume
description: Also called the Widowmaker, it is the shifting mass of logs queued for processing that oftentimes chokes the River Koln. Site of some of the most daring and/or stupid of Coinmarches residents.

title: Logjumpers
description: A local tavern bearing the nickname of one of the major careers of the island. Usually full of off-shift workers from the mill or other businesses.

title: Drivers Union Hall
description: Recently renovated after a destructive fire, it contains the various offices of union administrators and a meeting hall for local log drivers.

title: Breaker Beacon
description: A short, soot-stained lighthouse at the North end of the island. Has long served as a navigation tool for mariners and barge captains.
